comment: Dr. Stockton is not a bad teacher but I did not understand his explanations of calculus at all. I went to all of his office hours, did all of my homework, and still had to withdraw because I was struggling so much. If you're generally okay at math then he's probably great, but he's not good for those who really have a difficult time with math.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Stockton is a great professor who gives great lectures. His lectures notes are kind of fill in the blanks. There are quizzes called Skills Checks every class. They add up to a whole test grade. His test basically follow the study guide and he replaces lowest test grade with the final. An A is achievable if you work hard enough in his class!!!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Best professor you will EVER have. All of the assignments are pretty easy and you can get so many bonus points. He does not give a lot of homework and the final is exemptible if you have a 100 in the class.

Great professor! It shows that he's been doing this for a while. Show up to class, do your homework and calculus will be (fairly) easy. The final grade (which is multiple choice) replaces your lowest test score. I turned my F into an A. Skills checks and homework are also a pretty good grade booster. He also randomly yells "SPEAK!" during class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: He is a full time high school teacher- so he's good at breaking things down! There are 4 unit exams with 6 lessons in each. There is web assign homework for each lesson (DO ALL OF THEM-it makes a huge difference in your grade) There is a "skills check" at the end of each class for the lesson from the class before worth 5 points- study for these!
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: DO NOT LET THE OTHER REVIEWS FOOL YOU. I'm honestly not sure why he has such great reviews, unless you're great with calculus. He tends to brush over things as if we should already know it. I definitely would not take him if you are not good at calculus to begin with. I need at least a C in this class. Not even sure I can get that.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Stockton is the best professor I've had at KSU. His interactive guided notes helped the entire class understand the material and his quizzes at the end of every class provoked the student to study/look over their notes at least every other day. Calculus is a hard class, but Stockton makes it so much easier. Take him.

James Stockton is a great professor and made learning calculus enjoyable. He has a good sense of humor, is very passionate about calculus and really knows his stuff so he is great at helping you understand the material.

Dr. Stockton is an amazing professor. He is kind and funny. He says all of the things that you are thinking right out loud. "Stupid math, what the heck?" He gives 2 question quizzes (called skills checks) every class, but they help keep you on track. Plenty of extra credit opportunities, and the tests are easier than both the notes and homework.

He is just a perfect guy for calculus. Guys if you're looking an A in calculus please take him. There can't be better professors than him. Do his reviews and go over the skills check and you have an A in the class.

His class was not an easy A, but he makes it easily achievable if you put the work into it, Skills checks every class to cover the material from the day before, which makes up the tests along with a study guide with problems from the book. 10 pts of bonus on each test, gives partial credit where it really counts, overall GREAT PROFESSOR!!

GREAT professor!Although I dropped his class(due to my own faults)I am def trying to take him again.I'm a slow learner when it comes to calc and one thing that did get me were those daily quizzes!I did the homework and 'thought' I understood it but NOPE. Just study hard (if you're like me, harder) and you should walk out with an A.

I absolutely despise Calculus but he got me through it, and I ended up making an A. He's amazing and explains everything in several different ways so you can grasp the method and concept. He makes it much easier to focus. He's very helpful and nice. If you hate Calculus or have a hard time with it, definitely take him! He's amazing and very clear.

I been going school for a year taken chemistry 1211, 1212, and Biology. I have never had troubled with math in my life. Always understood everything easily when explained the steps. I dropped his class on the last day and got my first W. I could not keep up with him. Those DQs killed me. I tried but just did not understand. I would not recommend.

Dr. Stockton is great. He makes calculus accessible, graspable, understandable, and applicable. He works through stuff a little slowly, so if your a "math ninja" (his words, not mine), I recommend taking a more challenging professor. For the math illiterate (like me), take him above anyone else.

He is a funny, sarcastic guy. Everyday we have skill checks, so make sure you know the material you learned from the previous class. He is great at clarifying the material we learn. Though I am not the best at math, I enjoyed learning Calculus from him. Take him if you can!

I absolutely loved his class! He gives homework quizzes so if you actually do your homework, they serve as a grade booster. He explains all the materials very well and his funny personality makes his class entertaining. The tests are hard, but he replaces your lowest grade with your grade from the final. I highly recommend him!!
